Traces of Old Egyptian in Eurasian languages

To linguists in the 19th centuries it came as a revelation when they discovered that the old Persian and Sanscrit words for family members were virtually identical to European variants:

𐎶𐎠𐎫𐎠 MaTa mother 𓅓𓅱𓏏𓅐
𐎱𐎡𐎫𐎠 PiTa father 𓇋𓏏𓆑𓀀
𐎲𐎼𐎠𐎫𐎠 BraTa brother 𓌢𓈖𓀀 twin,kin𓅸
*𐎯𐎧𐎬𐎠 Duxtar daughter 𓅭𓏏
𐎱𐎢𐏂 Pučun puer/son 𓅭⇔𓇳
( 𐎶 = M, 𐎠 = A, 𐎫 = T, 𐎠 = A, 𐎲 = B … e.t.c. )

Even now, 2500 years after Persians hammered those words into stone, the Iranian(Farsi) words are almost identical, surviving an Arabian conquest and millenia of separation, but reinforced by international relationships and intermarriages:
پدر pedar father(formal)
بابا bâbâ father
مادر mâdar mother(formal)
مامان mâmân mother
پسر pesar son
دختر doxtar daughter

This (re)discovery lead to well established theories of proto-indoeuropean expansions. Here we investigate the relationship between these pioneers and the Pharaonic Egyptian language and culture.

The roots of the Persian language came via the region of Elam with its capital Susa on the eastern border of Sumeria. Strikingly the cultural artefacts of Egypt and Susa were nearly identical:

susa-egypt.png
Near identical building plans of the early temples and very similar early Egyptian and Sumerian ceremonies clearly demonstrate that these are not mere trade-artefacts, but in fact proof of a common anchestry of both higher civilizations.
Some context of this urbanization can be explored in the paper the Kurgan Copper Revolution.
Only recently has the Maykop culture been redated to begin at 4000BC. As it contains more gold and artefacts from Uruk() than the whole rest of Mesopotamia, its central position in the formation of urbanization becomes more and more evident. Especially as it connects our European roots with the two great civilizations of Mesopotamia and Egypt. Their kurgan mounts, some still reaching over 50 meters height, can be seen as predecessors of Egyptian, Iranian and Peruvian pyramids, which appeared some thousand years later. Central to this revolution were a bag of inventions, including metallurgy, proto-writing, «kingship» and the sail boat, which became a cult object in the Ubaid period -3800BC.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/516118/34747856-4410ad5c-f59a-11e7-9487-09e0edb096f6.png
In 5000BC the danube Vinča civilization pioneered advanced copper technology, in 4200BC the Varna hordes contain more gold artefacts than all other sites of that time combined. By that standard the Kurgan Copper Revolution reached Egypt quite late, though one of its watermark: industrial brewing and cast copper can be found as early as 3700BC.

Varna King, Romania ⋍4000BC
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/516118/34747926-924bb1ba-f59a-11e7-90ab-0b95a206ff58.png

Here we investigate how deeply the roots go and how the system, its cosmology and language are intertwined with our own:

Remember the persian words for mother and father?
Here are the Egyptian variants:

𓅓𓅱𓏏𓅐 Muta Gaia / Mother Nature 𓈖𓏏𓂋𓏯𓅐
𓊪𓏏𓇯𓀭 Pethair Sky Father 𓇋𓏏𓆑𓀀 *feathav

The Egyptian Hieroglyphic writing system started as a syllabary➾ but soon converged to a rather small set of frequent signs&sounds plus «determinants» (like 𓈉 for land).

Babylon is written 𓃀𓃀𓂋𓏤𓈉 B.b.l.1(𓈉land)
'L' 𓂋 «lense» «el'lips» actually is normally read as
'R' 𓂋 «rot» = «mouth» in Russian

Barbarion or not, the Egyptian letter 'b' 𓃀 looks almost like a flipped modern 'b' in writing (both writing directions were common initially). The word '𓃀' itself is cognate with european variants: Bein, Pod, foot, la pierna: lab' vs leg(𓃀⋍L) …

Every single letter in this “Alphabet” of Egyptian hieroglyphs left a tremendous linguistic footprint on most surrounding and quite distant extinct and extant languages

But other icons are highly recognizable as well:
𓃟 Shu.wn 𓆄𓅱 swine
𓆣 K-ph-r-r 𓐍𓊪𓂋𓂋𓆣 Käfer beetle
𓆤 Horned Beetles 𓃀𓇋𓇋𓏏 bees
𓄜 Tier deer
𓂓𓂓 kwerKar work
𓂜𓈖 None, mano, no, nay
𓊖 Court (city quarters)
𓇳 soRay 🌞
𓊛 Shiphonit
𓌵 Mvoyer
𓋬 MatheMathei𓆇
𓄟 Mes mnais Moses
𓄣 Heart
𓉡 Hathor = 𓉗hut+𓅃hor Hüter of Herds 𓉔𓄿𓂋𓏏𓄜𓏥 𓃒
𓅭𓏏 could be … duckter

This Discovery is not entirely new, Dr. Christian De Vartavan, former head of the Armenian Egyptology Centre released several papers on the subject. In fact this connection was much more widely spread before the second world war, which partly explains why it has been a taboo since then. Another reason were the undeniable strong connections to Semitic languages; this however is not a contradiction:

Egyptian had a big influence on Semitic, African and European languages.

The most important sign of early urbanizers was probably
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/516118/34748045-0882e4de-f59b-11e7-9d50-ddf7c57b491a.png
1.KRad𓐍 (wheel)
2.soRay𓇳 (solar wheel / sun)
3.court𓊖city
4.quarter𓊖 𓆑𓂧𓅱:ЧⲦⲞⲞⲨ:four see numbers and cosmos
